snp1.5:2.3: _Sakkhipuṭṭho_ is only elsewhere used in the context of being asked to bear witness in court. I think the context is relevant here, as the Buddha is offering personal testimony on a matter that otherwise he may not speak.
snp1.5:6.2: Norman and Bodhi both read _pada_ as “way”, but it surely means “passage” as eg. [an4.191:1.7]().
